intro: Centaurea iljiniana, commonly known as Iljin's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its bright blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Centaurea iljiniana is considered a rare and endangered species.
